item.title: 中国拥挤的葡萄酒市场没有为苦苦挣扎的全球产业提供生命线
item.description: 中国将取消反倾销关税，重新开放进口葡萄酒市场，这一消息令澳大利亚葡萄酒业欢欣鼓舞，但2024年更为严峻的经济形势不太可能带来酿酒师们所寻求的起泡酒增长。【原文：Australia's wine industry has cheered news that China will drop anti-dumping tariffs, re-opening its market to imports, but the tougher economic conditions of 2024 are unlikely to deliver the sparkling growth winemakers seek.】

item.title: 代理顾问 CGI Glass Lewis 建议伍德赛德能源公司董事长下台
item.description: 代理顾问 CGI Glass Lewis 要求澳大利亚伍德赛德能源公司（Woodside Energy）的股东在本月晚些时候举行的年度股东大会上投票反对重新选举董事长理查德-戈伊德（Richard Goyder），并反对该公司的气候战略。【原文：Proxy advisor CGI Glass Lewis has asked shareholders of Australia's Woodside Energy to vote against the re-election of Chairman Richard Goyder and against the company's climate strategy at the annual general meeting later this month.】

item.title: 菲律宾 3 月通胀再次加快，大米价格飙升
item.description: 菲律宾 3 月份的年通胀率连续第二个月加速上升，其中大米通胀率创下 15 年来最快增速，这使得中央银行有理由继续收紧政策设置。【原文：Philippine annual inflation accelerated for the second straight month in March as the rice component jumped at the fastest pace in 15 years, giving the central bank reason to keep policy settings tight.】

item.title: 科技股暴跌，日本日经指数创 2022 年 12 月以来最差一周
item.description: 由于科技股在华尔街的带动下下滑，日本日经平均股价周五下跌超过 2%，创下三周以来的新低，本周将创下自 2022 年 12 月以来的最差表现。【原文：Japan's Nikkei share average tumbled more than 2% to a three-week low on Friday, putting it on course for its worst week since December 2022 as tech shares slid on Wall Street's lead.】

item.title: 亚洲股市因风险厌恶情绪下跌；油价攀升
item.description: 周五亚洲股市回落，原因是一些美联储官员的鹰派言论和地缘政治紧张局势的升级打击了风险情绪，而在当天晚些时候公布美国就业数据之前，交易商也持谨慎态度。【原文：Asian shares retreated on Friday as hawkish comments from some Federal Reserve officials and escalating geopolitical tensions put a dent in risk sentiment, while traders were also cautious ahead of U.S. jobs data due later in the day.】

item.title: 日本警告避免日元过度波动，并再次进行口头干预
item.description: 日本财务大臣铃木俊一周五表示，过度的汇率波动是不可取的，并重申政府决心采取适当行动防止日元大幅下跌。【原文：Japanese Finance Minister Shunichi Suzuki said on Friday excessive exchange-rate moves were undesirable, reiterating the government's resolve to take appropriate actions against sharp yen falls.】

item.title: 受地缘政治紧张局势和供应担忧影响，油价将迎来第二周上涨
item.description: 受欧洲和中东地缘政治紧张局势、对供应收紧的担忧以及对经济改善带来的全球燃料需求增长的乐观情绪的支撑，周五油价扩大涨幅，并实现了第二次单周上涨。【原文：Oil prices extended gains on Friday and headed for a second weekly gain, supported by geopolitical tensions in Europe and the Middle East, concerns over tightening supply, and optimism about global fuel demand growth as economies improve.】

item.title: 就业数据公布前美元持稳；日元创两周新高
item.description: 周五，美元兑其他货币在从两周低点反弹后持稳，交易员为当天晚些时候将发布的一份关键就业报告做准备，并对中东紧张局势持谨慎态度。【原文：The U.S. dollar held steady against peer currencies on Friday after rebounding from a two-week low, as traders braced for a key jobs report due later in the day and grew cautious over tensions in the Middle East.】

item.title: 耶伦就中国生产过剩威胁召开有争议的会议
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周五将与中国高级官员展开为期四天的会谈，预计会谈将重点讨论中国制造业产能过剩的外溢效应以及美国企业面临的日益严峻的商业环境。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen on Friday kicks off four days of talks with senior Chinese officials expected to focus heavily on spillovers from China's excess manufacturing capacity and an increasingly challenging business climate for U.S. firms.】

item.title: 美国在与中国的会晤中提出商业和市场准入问题
item.description: 美国商务部表示，美国官员周四在与中国官员的会晤中提出了影响美国公司的商业和市场准入问题，讨论的议题包括跨境数据流动和监管透明度。【原文：U.S. officials on Thursday raised commercial and market access issues impacting American companies in a meeting with Chinese officials on Thursday, the U.S. Commerce Department said, with cross-border data flows and regulatory transparency among topics discussed.】

item.title: 芯片价格回升，三星第一季度利润增长 10 倍
item.description: 三星电子周五预计其第一季度营业利润将增长 10 倍以上，原因是半导体价格的反弹使其盈利从一年前芯片需求严重下滑时的低点回升。【原文：Samsung Electronics estimated on Friday a more than 10-fold rise in its first-quarter operating profit, as rebounding semiconductor prices lifted earnings from a low base a year ago when there was a severe downturn in chip demand.】

item.title: Meta 回击美国联邦贸易委员会修改 2020 年隐私协议的要求
item.description: Meta Platforms 拒绝了美国联邦贸易委员会修改 2020 年隐私和解协议的企图，并指出该公司已主动向该机构披露了与 Messenger Kids 应用程序有关的两个技术错误。【原文：Meta Platforms has rebuffed an attempt by the U.S. Federal Trade Commission to amend a 2020 privacy settlement, noting that it had voluntarily disclosed two technical errors related to its Messenger Kids app to the agency.】

item.title: Humira生物仿制药销售滞后，勃林格将裁减销售人员
item.description: 勃林格殷格翰公司（Boehringer Ingelheim）周四表示，由于艾伯维（AbbVie）的关节炎治疗大片 Humira 的生物仿制药在美国销售不佳，该公司将裁减部分销售人员。【原文：Boehringer Ingelheim on Thursday said it will lay off some of its salesforce due to poor U.S. sales of its biosimilar version of AbbVie’s blockbuster arthritis treatment Humira.】

item.title: 贝莱德称首席执行官劳伦斯-芬克 2023 年薪酬将减少 18
item.description: 据贝莱德公司周四提交的监管文件显示，该公司首席执行官劳伦斯-芬克 2023 年的薪酬总额为 2690 万美元，低于去年同期的 3270 万美元。【原文：BlackRock CEO Laurence Fink's total pay for 2023 was $26.9 million, down from $32.7 million a year earlier, according to the company's regulatory filings on Thursday.】

item.title: J&J 建议股东拒绝 TRC Capital Investment 的 "迷你投标 "要约
item.description: 强生公司（Johnson & Johnson）周四表示，建议其股东拒绝 TRC Capital Investment Corporation 主动提出的收购其约 0.04% 普通股的 "迷你要约"。【原文：Johnson & Johnson said on Thursday it has recommended its shareholders to reject an unsolicited "mini-tender" offer by TRC Capital Investment Corporation for about 0.04% of its common stock.】

item.title: 早间竞标：美联储言论刺伤情绪，印度提供利率指导
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 独家报道美联储主席巴金降息的信心需要通胀的广度收窄
item.description: 里士满联储主席托马斯-巴尔金表示，他正密切关注商品和服务业通胀的持续广泛性，并认为价格上涨放缓需要更加普遍，然后他才能放心地降息。【原文：Richmond Federal Reserve President Thomas Barkin said he is focused intently on the persistent breadth of inflation across goods and services, and feels slower price increases need to be more widespread before he is comfortable cutting interest rates.】

item.title: Cboe Global Markets 寻求美国证券交易委员会批准上市 ETF 股份类别结构
item.description: 美国证券交易所（Cboe Global Markets）周四表示，已向美国证券交易委员会（SEC）提出申请，要求监管部门批准其修改规则，允许发行人在现有共同基金中增加交易所交易基金（ETF）份额类别。【原文：Cboe Global Markets filed a request with the SEC for regulatory approval to change its rules and allow issuers to add an exchange-traded fund (ETF) share class to existing mutual funds, the exchange said on Thursday.】

item.title: 纽约州法官宣布纽约州大麻法规无效
item.description: 在一起质疑大麻广告规则的案件中，纽约州一名法官宣布该州大部分大麻法规无效。【原文：A New York state judge has invalidated most of the state’s cannabis regulations in a case that challenged marijuana advertising rules.】

item.title: 美国希望航空公司提高军人的旅行福利
item.description: 美国运输部长皮特-巴蒂吉格（Pete Buttigieg）周四敦促美国最大的客运航空公司改善现役军人及其家属的旅行福利。【原文：U.S. Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg on Thursday urged the nation's largest passenger airlines to improve travel benefits for active-duty military personnel and their families.】

item.title: 日本央行暗示近期加息，推高收益率
item.description: 据《朝日新闻》报道，日本央行行长上田一夫表示，随着丰厚的加薪推动物价上涨，通胀可能会从 "夏季向秋季 "加速，这是他迄今为止最强烈地暗示未来几个月可能再次加息。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda said inflation would likely accelerate from "summer toward autumn" as bumper pay hikes push up prices, the Asahi newspaper reported, his strongest hint yet that another interest rate hike was possible in coming months.】

item.title: 独家报道美国司法部将会见波音空难受害者律师
item.description: 据路透社通讯报道，美国司法部下周将与2018年和2019年造成346人死亡的两起波音737 MAX致命空难的受害者家属的律师会面，政府将决定是否继续推进刑事案件。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department next week will meet with lawyers for families of victims of two fatal Boeing 737 MAX crashes that killed 346 people in 2018 and 2019, as the government decides whether to move ahead with a criminal case, according to correspondence Reuters reviewed.】

item.title: 美联储古尔斯比称房价压力构成最大通胀风险
item.description: 芝加哥联储主席奥斯汀-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周四表示，美国中央银行努力将通胀率恢复到 2% 目标值的最大障碍是住房服务业的价格涨幅持续过大。【原文：The largest impediment to the U.S. central bank's efforts to return inflation to its 2% target rate is the persistence of outsized price increases in the housing services sector, Chicago Federal Reserve President Austan Goolsbee said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美联储卡什卡利称，如果通胀继续停滞不前，2024 年降息将面临威胁
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）周四表示，在上个月的美国央行会议上，他为今年的两次降息埋下了伏笔，但如果通胀继续停滞不前，年底前可能不需要降息。【原文：Minneapolis Federal Reserve Bank President Neel Kashkari said on Thursday that at the U.S. central bank's meeting last month he penciled in two interest rate cuts this year but if inflation continues to stall, none may be required by year end.】

item.title: 美国银行称主动型美国基金取得 2007 年以来最佳季度业绩
item.description: 博雅全球研究公司（BofA Global Research）的策略师表示，第一季度主动管理型美国股票基金取得了自 2007 年以来的最佳季度业绩。【原文：Actively managed U.S. equity funds in the first quarter posted their best quarterly out-performance since 2007, BofA Global Research strategists said.】

item.title: 美国小型企业联合会（NFIB）称，美国小型企业再次缩减招聘计划
item.description: 周四公布的一项调查显示，3月份美国小型企业的招聘计划是自2020年5月大流行病停摆导致经济陷入衰退以来最弱的一次，低于一些经济学家视为更广泛就业市场风向标的关键门槛。【原文：Hiring plans among U.S. small businesses in March were the weakest since May 2020 when pandemic shutdowns threw the economy into recession, dropping below a key threshold some economists see as a bellwether for the wider job market, a survey out on Thursday showed.】

item.title: 高盛和摩根士丹利必须面对投资者就 Archegos 倒闭提起的诉讼
item.description: 纽约州一家上诉法院表示，前 ViacomCBS 投资者可以起诉高盛、摩根士丹利和其他为该媒体公司两次股票发行提供担保的银行，维持了银行担心可能会颠覆资本市场的一项裁决。【原文：A New York state appeals court said former ViacomCBS investors may sue Goldman Sachs , Morgan Stanley and other banks that underwrote two stock offerings for the media company, upholding a ruling that banks fear could upend capital markets.】

item.title: 美国针对华为的刑事案件将于 2026 年开审
item.description: 美国司法部指控中国华为公司在伊朗业务方面误导银行等罪名的刑事案件即将于 2026 年 1 月开庭审理。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department's criminal case accusing China's Huawei of misleading banks about the tech company's business in Iran, among other charges, is heading toward a January 2026 trial.】

item.title: 摩根大通重组全球银行业领导层：备忘录
item.description: 根据路透社周四看到的一份备忘录，摩根大通重组了全球银行部门的领导层。【原文：JPMorgan Chase reorganized its leadership in the global banking division, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普将在与媒体公司联合创始人的纠纷中接受质询
item.description: 共和党总统候选人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）定于本月晚些时候接受其社交媒体公司联合创始人律师的质询，这是上周上市的特朗普媒体与科技集团（Trump Media & Technology Group）所有权纠纷的一部分。【原文：Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump is scheduled to be deposed later this month by lawyers for co-founders of his social media company as part of a dispute over ownership in Trump Media & Technology Group , which went public last week.】
